The other more prudent Spaniards strongly opposed the design, truly,observing: “These rascally Abipones, the dregs of the whole nation, come hither from the sear¹ of punishment, not from the desire of embracing religion: it is not a colony, but an asylum where they may commit crimes with impunity, that they seek amongst the Spaniards3 and even if this were not the case, a province so indigent in every respect as this, cannot afford the supplies necessary for founding and preser— ving such a colony.” The same was the opinion of all the J esuits.
